post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
of a movie titel, which i think, was by far the best i watched as of now; so let's conclude: its a allegory about the sun system, in where a story was aligned to every planet we found to far: moon, jupiter, mars and so one: but driven by the main actor; and u have to listen right, it was JESUS! not that beloved jesus we have to know from churches, no. more about the true wisdom lying dept in our heart, unspoiled, still listening to whats may be comming next. i know that topic is full of "what the heck he's talking about?" but i watched that movie back in 2008 on arte (god forgive me) and it was so full off metaphors and allegorys that i have really no clue where to start my search. AND; there was a scene where our "beloved" hero, let's call him jesus, was supposed to give away his freedom, his inner ego, his all or or nothing. this scene was about "all" and the "jüngers" stand behind him and weren't aware of whats the conclusin may be. k, not that easy to understand what iam trying to say here, mabye, but if somone of u has the slightest idea of what i could mean so PM me. thanks!


ah and yeah; w'r talking about 1960 to 1970 timeframe

post.author: Alternate
post.body:
With due all respect, sir, I got a huge headache while reading your post.

Please learn how to write correctly :I

And no. I do not know what you are talking about.

And yes, I like to put blank spaces everywhere

post.author: Hostyle
post.body: The holy mountain?

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
Alternate wrote:
quak quak quak


nah, i ,u, a, i , u, a,,,and i allwyas thought my jokes were bad,,,,anyway: why answer when u have nothing to say!


Quote:
The holy mountain


fuck you! i LOVE you! at least someone got me right! u sir have my conciseness! amen!

/and by the way: dont watch that movie, or u'll get crazy like me

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
When i first read your post it looked like you were buzzin on yokes but if you really want a mind warp and to think of finer things watch the movie koyaanisqatsi or powaqqatsi!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dzEFRVoSoNo
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CUDKfxdGFYk

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
no, really, i like that forum more than thought and to be given that answer was more than a "JOKE"!

there are some guys here around that truly understand the term of WISDOM!

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
qwertz123 wrote:
no, really, i like that forum more than thought and to be given that answer was more than a "JOKE"!

there are some guys here around that truly understand the term of WISDOM!

eh?

edit: lol i just got that!

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
Douglas Quaid wrote:
When i first read your post it looked like you were buzzin on yokes but if you really want a mind warp and to think of finer things watch the movie koyaanisqatsi or powaqqatsi!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dzEFRVoSoNo
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CUDKfxdGFYk



coppola? the conversation (the number one on my best film list)? apocalypse now?


anyway: the music to the "Koyaanisqatsi" (thank u for that link cuz it was quite good!) movie did remind me a little of Michael Nyman, just a little. don't want it to be ordinary!

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: Nyman is top. The Promise is one of his best pieces. You should try Steve Reich's Different Trains but you may not like it. If you are used to classical music you'll enjoy it. Not to sound pompus but if you want a good music fix just ask. I've been composing for 12 years and I have a big library

post.author: qwertz123
post.body: i feel welcome, thank you!

post.author: Hostyle
post.body: There is also a movie called "The Lucifer Rising". If you havent watched it, watch it.

post.body:
hey qwertz here's a fun tune from my session days, enjoy:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iaLeus8hrM0

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
quite funny, but the topic wasn't online anymore, so google was my friend

anyway: dirk ivens* and hellhammer, anything more and less; and i don't care anymore...cuz it's my VIBE!

still enjoying ur input, so lets it rolling peeps!



*ABC of course


/oldschool vibe, john, u still feel the beat down ur eggs? doesn't u? k, kinda offtopic, but we have quakecon 2k8 and things gonna be sadder as thought so i still feel accomplished! don't u?
